cards.description:
2025-10-20 17:35:49
---

The ci woes continue

The current progress is that of 

---

  New Idempotent Release Pipeline

  Two new minimal scripts:
  - aggregate-changesets.sh - Finds highest priority bump type (major > minor > patch)
  - update-changelog.sh - Merges changesets into CHANGELOG.md with version header

  Updated workflows:

  1. aggregate-changesets.yml (on develop PR close):
    - Aggregates all changesets into CHANGELOG.md
    - Single version bump per release cycle
    - Cleans up changesets
    - Commits to develop
  2. release.yml (on master PR close):
    - Compares Cargo.toml version vs last git tag
    - If version changed → publish & tag
    - If version unchanged → skip (idempotent!)
    - No changeset checking, no pushing back to master

  Benefits:
  - ✅ Idempotent: Version is source of truth, safe to re-run
  - ✅ Maintainable: Simple version comparison logic
  - ✅ Single version bump: One bump per release cycle
  - ✅ Changelog preserved: Full history in CHANGELOG.md
  - ✅ Zero race conditions: No pushing to trigger branch

---

Moving cards to and from columns also seem broken

cards.description:
We want to be able to create git branches and tie them to specific tasks so that we can trace the history.

Be able to specify a prefix for use in the project

- Set prefix in Board settings
- Assign prefix + autoincremented number to card
- From a card. Copy branch name
- From a card. Copy `git checkout -b prefix+id`

Should the id be autoincrement or uuid?

Readability says it should be autoincremented. So we go with that for now.

- If no prefix fallback to a default.
- Customize default. Requires application configuration file feature?

╭────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
│ Git Branch Integration Implementation Plan                     │
│                                                                │
│ Core Design Decisions                                          │
│                                                                │
│ - Branch ID: Auto-incremented u32 per board (decided:          │
│ readability over UUIDs)                                        │
│ - Prefix Hierarchy: Board prefix → App config default → "task" │
│  fallback                                                      │
│ - ID Assignment: Lazy (on first request) to avoid assigning    │
│ IDs to cards that never need branches                          │
│ - Branch Format: {prefix}-{id} (e.g., feature-42, task-17)     │
│                                                                │
│ ---                                                            │
│ 1. Domain Layer (kanban-domain)                                │
│                                                                │
│ Board model (board.rs):                                        │
│ - Add branch_prefix: Option<String> field                      │
│ - Add next_card_id: u32 field (default: 1)                   │
│ - Add update_branch_prefix(&mut self, prefix: Option<String>)  │
│ method                                                         │
│ - Add allocate_card_id(&mut self) -> u32 method              │
│                                                                │
│ Card model (card.rs):                                          │
│ - Add card_id: Option<u32> field                             │
│ - Add ensure_card_id(&mut self, board: &mut Board) method    │
│ - Add branch_name(&self, board: &Board, default_prefix: &str)  │
│ -> Option<String> method                                       │
│ - Add git_checkout_command(&self, board: &Board,               │
│ default_prefix: &str) -> Option<String> method                 │
│ - Add prefix validation (no spaces, git-safe characters)       │
│                                                                │
│ ---                                                            │
│ 2. Application Configuration (kanban-core)                     │
│                                                                │
│ Create new config.rs module:                                   │
│ - Define AppConfig struct with default_branch_prefix:          │
│ Option<String>                                                 │
│ - Use config crate or simple TOML parsing                      │
│ - Config file location: ~/.config/kanban/config.toml           │
│ - Load config on app startup in kanban-cli                     │
│ - Thread through to TUI via App struct                         │
│                                                                │
│ ---                                                            │
│ 3. Clipboard Integration (kanban-tui)                          │
│                                                                │
│ Add dependencies to kanban-tui/Cargo.toml:                     │
│ - arboard = "3.4" (cross-platform clipboard)                   │
│                                                                │
│ Create new clipboard.rs module:                                │
│ - copy_to_clipboard(text: &str) -> io::Result<()>              │
│ - Handle errors gracefully (e.g., headless environments)       │
│                                                                │
│ ---                                                            │
│ 4. TUI Layer (kanban-tui)                                      │
│                                                                │
│ App struct (app.rs):                                           │
│ - Add app_config: AppConfig field                              │
│ - Add clipboard operations to card detail mode                 │
│                                                                │
│ Board settings (new mode AppMode::BoardSettings):              │
│ - Add focus state for navigating board settings                │
│ - Edit branch prefix with external editor or inline input      │
│ - Show current prefix, effective prefix (with fallback chain)  │
│                                                                │
│ Card detail view (ui.rs):                                      │
│ - Show branch ID (if assigned)                                 │
│ - Show computed branch name                                    │
│ - Show git checkout command                                    │
│                                                                │
│ Key bindings (in CardDetail mode):                             │
│ - b - Assign branch ID (if not already assigned)               │
│ - y - Copy branch name to clipboard                            │
│ - Y - Copy git checkout -b {branch} to clipboard               │
│ - Add to help text                                             │
│                                                                │
│ New AppMode variants:                                          │
│ - BoardSettings - for editing board-level settings             │
│ - SetBranchPrefix - dialog for setting prefix                  │
│                                                                │
│ ---                                                            │
│ 5. Persistence                                                 │
│                                                                │
│ Update serialization/deserialization:                          │
│ - Board export/import already uses serde                       │
│ - New fields automatically included                            │
│ - Migration: existing boards get branch_prefix: None,          │
│ next_card_id: 1                                              │
│ - Existing cards get card_id: None                           │
│                                                                │
│ ---                                                            │
│ 6. Testing Strategy                                            │
│                                                                │
│ Unit tests:                                                    │
│ - Branch ID allocation (sequential, no gaps)                   │
│ - Branch name generation with different prefix scenarios       │
│ - Prefix validation (reject invalid git characters)            │
│ - Clipboard operations (mock if needed)                        │
│                                                                │
│ Integration tests:                                             │
│ - Round-trip serialization with new fields                     │
│ - Multiple cards getting sequential IDs                        │
│                                                                │
│ ---                                                            │
│ 7. Implementation Order                                        │
│                                                                │
│ 1. Add AppConfig in kanban-core                                │
│ 2. Update Board domain model with prefix + next_card_id      │
│ 3. Update Card domain model with card_id + methods           │
│ 4. Add clipboard module to kanban-tui                          │
│ 5. Update App struct to hold config                            │
│ 6. Add board settings mode in TUI                              │
│ 7. Add card detail branch operations                           │
│ 8. Update help text and key bindings                           │
│ 9. Add tests                                                   │
│ 10. Update CLAUDE.md with new features                         │
│                                                                │
│ ---                                                            │
│ 8. Edge Cases & Validation                                     │
│                                                                │
│ - Validate prefix: alphanumeric + hyphens only, no             │
│ leading/trailing hyphens                                       │
│ - Max branch name length: git supports ~255 chars, warn if     │
│ prefix + ID exceeds reasonable length                          │
│ - Clipboard unavailable: show friendly error, fallback to      │
│ displaying text                                                │
│ - Board without prefix: use app config default or "task"       │
│ - Cards created before feature: assign IDs on demand           │
│                                                                │
│ ---                                                            │
│ Example Usage Flow                                             │
│                                                                │
│ 1. User opens board settings (s in projects view)              │
│ 2. Sets prefix to "feat"                                       │
│ 3. Navigates to card, presses b to assign branch ID → card     │
│ gets card_id=1                                               │
│ 4. Board's next_card_id increments to 2                      │
│ 5. User presses y → copies "feat-1" to clipboard               │
│ 6. User presses Y → copies "git checkout -b feat-1" to         │
│ clipboard                                                      │
│ 7. Next card gets card_id=2, branch name "feat-2"            │
│                                                                │
│ ---                                                            │
│ Dependencies to add:                                           │
│ - arboard = "3.4" (clipboard)                                  │
│ - config = "0.14" (optional, for TOML config parsing)          │
│ - OR use simple std::fs::read_to_string + toml = "0.8" for     │
│ lightweight config

cards.description:
Introduce two features

# Block

- Add blocked by card
- Add create blocker. Creating the new card that would be the blocker.

# Grouping of cards under one card

I would like to keep things flat but I would like card meta data where I can group cards by a top level card.

The interface would present the grouping as nested to begin with and we see how it behaves?

Example

```
Implement Card Grouping ...
```

Which would when hit enter or space on expand into

```
Implement Card Grouping
  Create ui
  Add metadata
```

# Duplicate cards

When two cards propose changes that are two sides of the same coin. Be able to add them as siblings. 

But when two cards propose changes that are the same side of the same coin, we want to merge them together. Creating a new card by editing the description and title in a git conflict type way

The merging will ofcourse be handled by opening EDITOR and injecting the content into their respective section.

Example
---

Title

```
<<<<<<< KAN-0001
Card Background
=======
Card Background Color
>>>>>>> KAN-0002
```

Description

```
We want to introduce a new feature that
<<<<<<< KAN-0001
Makes card background purple
=======
Makes card background green
>>>>>>> KAN-0002
```

cards.description:
# At the board level. Be able to define columns

Default columns when creating a new board
---
- TODO
- Doing
- Complete

Features
---
- Be able to change the name of columns
- Be able to change order of columns
- Be able to add new columns
- Be able to remove columns
- Be able to add tasks to column
- Using 'c' is equivalent to moving a card to the last column. If there is only one column in a board, we can only set complete manually like the current implementation does.

UI
---
- hitting `c` in Board Details opens up Columns. In columns we see one panel listing the columns in order.
- In the 

### Task list

- Be able to view tasks in column view grouped by columns
- Be able to view tasks in list view grouped by columns
- Be able to view the task list without columns (current behavior)
- Extend the task list to have column task list
- Extend the task list to have list grouped by columns
- Choose which view is active in the task list panel by opening a list dialogue with the choices with `v`. The current view is saved to the board and loaded on startup.

Dupe of `KAN-31/update-status-of-a-card-board-columns`

Implementation
---
Implementation Plan: Column Definitions at Board Level                                                                               │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
Overview                                                                                                                             │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
Add full column management capabilities to the kanban board, allowing users to define, edit, reorder, and manage columns at the      │ │
board level. This includes default columns on board creation, a dedicated column management UI, and integration with task completion │ │
 workflows.                                                                                                                          │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
Architecture Changes                                                                                                                 │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
1. Domain Layer (kanban-domain)                                                                                                      │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
File: crates/kanban-domain/src/column.rs                                                                                             │ │
- Add update_name(&mut self, name: String) method                                                                                    │ │
- Add validation for column names (non-empty, unique within board)                                                                   │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
File: crates/kanban-domain/src/board.rs                                                                                              │ │
- Add default_column_definitions: Vec<String> field (default: ["TODO", "Doing", "Complete"])                                         │ │
- Add task_list_view: TaskListView enum field (default: TaskListView::Flat)                                                          │ │
- Add methods for column management at board level                                                                                   │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
New: crates/kanban-domain/src/task_list_view.rs                                                                                      │ │
- Define TaskListView enum: Flat, GroupedByColumn, ColumnView                                                                        │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
2. Application State (kanban-tui/src/app.rs)                                                                                         │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
Add new AppMode variants:                                                                                                            │ │
- ColumnManagement - Main column management view                                                                                     │ │
- CreateColumn - Dialog for creating new column                                                                                      │ │
- RenameColumn - Dialog for renaming column                                                                                          │ │
- DeleteColumnConfirm - Confirmation dialog for column deletion                                                                      │ │
- SelectTaskListView - Popup for selecting task list view type                                                                       │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
Add new Focus enum:                                                                                                                  │ │
- ColumnFocus with variants: ColumnList                                                                                              │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
Add to App struct:                                                                                                                   │ │
- column_selection: SelectionState - For navigating columns                                                                          │ │
- active_column_index: Option<usize> - Currently selected column                                                                     │ │
- task_list_view_selection: SelectionState - For view selection popup                                                                │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
3. UI Layer (kanban-tui/src/ui.rs)                                                                                                   │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
Add rendering functions:                                                                                                             │ │
- render_column_management_view() - Main column management interface                                                                 │ │
- render_create_column_popup() - Column creation dialog                                                                              │ │
- render_rename_column_popup() - Column rename dialog                                                                                │ │
- render_delete_column_confirm_popup() - Deletion confirmation                                                                       │ │
- render_select_task_list_view_popup() - View selection popup                                                                        │ │
- Update render_tasks_panel() to support three view modes                                                                            │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
4. Handlers                                                                                                                          │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
New: crates/kanban-tui/src/handlers/column_handlers.rs                                                                               │ │
- handle_column_management_key() - Navigate and manage columns                                                                       │ │
- handle_create_column_key() - Initiate column creation                                                                              │ │
- handle_rename_column_key() - Initiate column renaming                                                                              │ │
- handle_delete_column_key() - Delete column with confirmation                                                                       │ │
- handle_move_column_up() - Reorder columns (decrease position)                                                                      │ │
- handle_move_column_down() - Reorder columns (increase position)                                                                    │ │
- handle_toggle_task_list_view() - Switch between view modes                                                                         │ │
- create_column() - Logic to add column to board                                                                                     │ │
- rename_column() - Logic to update column name                                                                                      │ │
- delete_column() - Logic to remove column (move cards to first column)                                                              │ │
- reorder_columns() - Update position fields                                                                                         │ │

Update: crates/kanban-tui/src/handlers/detail_view_handlers.rs                                                                       │ │
- Add KeyCode::Char('5') handler for BoardFocus::Columns in BoardDetail                                                              │ │
- Add BoardFocus::Columns to handle_board_detail_key()                                                                               │ │

Update: crates/kanban-tui/src/handlers/card_handlers.rs                                                                              │ │

Key Bindings                                                                                                                         │ │

Board Detail View                                                                                                                    │ │

Column Management View                                                                                                               │ │

- ESC - Return to Board Detail                                                                                                       │ │
- n - Create new column                                                                                                              │ │
- r - Rename selected column                                                                                                         │ │
- d - Delete selected column (with confirmation)                                                                                     │ │
- j/k or ↓/↑ - Navigate columns                                                                                                      │ │

- K or Ctrl+Up - Move column up in order                                                                                             │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
Task List View                                                                                                                       │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
- v - Open view selection dialog (Flat / Grouped by Column / Column View)                                                            │ │
- View preference saved per board                                                                                                    │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
Implementation Sequence                                                                                                              │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
1. Domain models - Update Board, Column, add TaskListView enum                                                                       │ │
2. Board initialization - Auto-create default columns on board creation                                                              │ │
3. App state - Add new modes, focus types, selections                                                                                │ │
4. Column handlers - Implement all column management logic                                                                           │ │
5. UI rendering - Add column management view and popups                                                                              │ │
6. Task list views - Implement three view modes (Flat, Grouped, Column)                                                              │ │
7. Card completion - Update to move to last column                                                                                   │ │
8. Export/Import - Update serialization to handle new fields                                                                         │ │
9. Testing - Verify column CRUD, reordering, view switching, card movement                                                           │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
Suggestions for Future Enhancements                                                                                                  │ │
                                                                                                                                     │ │
- WIP limits per column (already in Column model, just needs UI)                                                                     │ │
- Customizable column colors                                                                                                         │ │
- Archive columns instead of delete                                                                                                  │ │
- Column templates for new boards                                                                                                    │ │

Move Card
---

1. Manual Card Column Movement (H/L keys):
   - H (Shift+h) - Moves selected card to the previous (left) column
   - L (Shift+l) - Moves selected card to the next (right) column
   - Focus tracking: The card selection stays on the moved card after movement
   - Edge case handling: Warns if already at first/last column
 2. Updated Card Completion Behavior (c key):
   - When pressing c on a card:
       - If the board has multiple columns: Moves card to the last column AND marks it as Done
     - If the board has only 1 column: Just toggles the status (fallback behavior)
   - Works for both single card completion and multi-select completion
   - Cards moved to the last column are automatically marked as complete
 3. UI Updates:
   - Footer help text now shows: H/L: move card
   - All functionality is ready to use

 How It Works:

 The implementation intelligently:
 - Sorts columns by position to determine left/right
 - Calculates the new position in the target column (appends to end)
 - Updates the card's column_id and position
 - Re-sorts the card list and finds the moved card's new index
 - Updates the selection to track the moved card

 The code compiles successfully and is ready for testing! 🎉
 
 Three interfaces
 ---
 Implement task list view modes rendering:                                                                                            │ │

1. Refactor render_main function to check view mode:                                                                                 │ │
  - For Flat and Grouped views: Keep current 2-panel layout (Projects 30% | Tasks 70%)                                               │ │
  - For ColumnView/Kanban: Hide projects panel, use full width for kanban board                                                      │ │
  - Check board.task_list_view to determine layout                                                                                   │ │
2. Refactor render_tasks_panel function to route based on view:                                                                      │ │
  - Match on board.task_list_view enum                                                                                               │ │
  - Call appropriate rendering function:                                                                                             │ │
      - Flat → existing flat list logic                                                                                              │ │
    - GroupedByColumn → new grouped rendering                                                                                        │ │
    - ColumnView → new kanban rendering                                                                                              │ │
3. Implement Grouped by Column view (render_tasks_grouped_by_column):                                                                │ │
  - Get sorted columns for the board                                                                                                 │ │
  - For each column:                                                                                                                 │ │
      - Render column name as a header (styled/bold, e.g., "TODO (3 tasks)")                                                         │ │
    - Filter cards by column_id                                                                                                      │ │
    - Render cards under that header                                                                                                 │ │
  - Handle card selection across all groups (track global index)                                                                     │ │
4. Implement Column/Kanban view (render_tasks_kanban_view):                                                                          │ │
  - Takes full area (no projects panel)                                                                                              │ │
  - Split area into N vertical panels (one per column)                                                                               │ │
  - Calculate equal-width constraints dynamically based on column count                                                              │ │
  - For each column panel:                                                                                                           │ │
      - Render as bordered panel with column name as title                                                                           │ │
    - Filter cards by column_id                                                                                                      │ │
    - Render cards in that panel                                                                                                     │ │
  - Handle card selection (track which card across all columns in order)                                                             │ │
  - Navigation: j/k moves through all cards left-to-right, top-to-bottom                                                             │ │
5. Update card selection tracking:                                                                                                   │ │
  - Keep card_selection as simple index into flat sorted list                                                                        │ │
  - All views use same underlying sorted card list                                                                                   │ │
  - Just render differently based on view mode                                                                                       │ │
6. Handle edge cases:                                                                                                                │ │
  - Empty columns in grouped/kanban view (show placeholder text)                                                                     │ │
  - Selection persistence when switching views                                                                                       │ │
  - Proper focus indicators in all modes                                                                                             │ │
  - Projects panel focus: disabled in kanban mode (only Cards focus active)                                                          │ │

cards.description:
# Steps to Add Your Project to Nixpkgs

## 1. Add Yourself as a Maintainer

First, you'll need to add yourself to the maintainer list in maintainers/maintainer-list.nix with a separate commit titled "maintainers: add <your-handle>".

## 2. Create the Package Expression

Since your Kanban is a Rust project, you'll use buildRustPackage from rustPlatform nixpkgs/doc/languages-frameworks/rust.section.md at master · NixOS/nixpkgs

[default.nix](./default.nix) 

## 3. Determine Package Location

Decide which pkgs/ subfolder your expression should live in, then add your expression under a directory like pkgs/applications/misc/kanban/default.nix or similar

## 4. Add to Package Index

Add an entry in pkgs/top-level/all-packages.nix so nixpkgs can find your package 

## 5. Fork and Test

Fork the nixpkgs repository, make your changes in a local branch, then build from the root of nixpkgs with nix-build -A kanban Nixpkgs/Contributing - NixOS Wiki

## 6. Handle the Hash Values

For the cargoHash, you can initially use an empty string or fake hash, and Nix will tell you the correct hash when you try to build nixpkgs/doc/languages-frameworks/rust.section.md at master · NixOS/nixpkgs

## 7. Submit a Pull Request

Once your package builds successfully, format your code with a Nix formatter like alejandra, then open a PR on GitHub with the title format "kanban: init at <version>" 

## 8. Wait for Review

Be patient - it's normal for PRs to sit for weeks. If you need help, you can reach out on NixOS Discourse or the Matrix channels

## Important Considerations

Read the commit conventions specific to pkgs and include relevant information in your commit messages so others can understand why changes were made 

The maintainers field is for you as the Nix expression maintainer, not the project maintainer. By submitting this package, you're taking responsibility for ongoing maintenance like version bumps

Using VHS record a demo so that we can post a gif of the tui to our github.

```
 Complete Demo Script: Building a Web API Project

  Scene 1: Launch & Create Board (0-15s)

  $ cargo run
  [TUI loads]
  Press 'n'
  Type: "Web API Project"
  Press Enter
  Narration: "Creating a new project for our web API development"

  Scene 2: Add Cards with Different Priorities (15-50s)

  Press '2' (switch to Tasks panel)
  Press 'n'
  Type: "Setup development environment"
  Press Enter

  Press 'n'
  Type: "Design database schema"
  Press Enter

  Press 'n'
  Type: "Implement authentication API"
  Press Enter

  Press 'n'
  Type: "Write integration tests"
  Press Enter
  Narration: "Adding tasks to our backlog"

  Scene 3: Edit Card Details - Full Metadata (50-90s)

  Press 'k' (move up to first card)
  Press Enter (open card detail)

  [Show Title panel highlighted]
  Press 'e'
  [External editor opens]
  Type: "Setup development environment\nInstall Rust, PostgreSQL, Docker"
  Save & exit

  Press '2' (switch to Metadata panel)
  Press 'e'
  Type: "3" (for 3 story points - Yellow badge)
  Press Enter

  Press 's' (change status)
  Type: "InProgress"
  Press Enter

  Press 'p' (change priority)
  Type: "High"
  Press Enter

  Press '3' (switch to Description panel)
  Press 'e'
  [External editor opens]
  Type: "Dependencies:\n- Rust 1.70+\n- PostgreSQL 15\n- Docker & docker-compose\n\nSetup steps:\n1. Install Rust toolchain\n2.
  Configure database\n3. Run initial migrations"
  Save & exit

  Press Escape (back to main view)
  Narration: "Setting story points, priority, status, and detailed description"

  Scene 4: Mark Card Complete & Copy Branch Name (90-110s)

  Press 'c' (toggle completion)
  [Card shows checkmark ✓]

  Press 'j' (move down)
  Press Enter (open second card)
  Press 'b' (copy branch name to clipboard)
  [Shows: "Copied branch name to clipboard"]

  Press 'y' (copy card ID)
  [Shows: "Copied card ID to clipboard"]

  Press Escape
  Narration: "Marking tasks complete and copying branch names for git workflow"

  Scene 5: Board Settings with Branch Prefix (110-130s)

  Press '1' (switch to Projects)
  Press 's' (open board settings)
  Press 'p' (set branch prefix)
  Type: "feat"
  Press Enter
  [Shows: "Branch prefix set to: feat"]
  Press Escape
  Narration: "Configuring git branch prefixes for consistent naming"

  Scene 6: Edit Board Details (130-150s)

  Press 'e' (edit board)
  [BoardDetail view opens]
  Press '2' (Description panel)
  Press 'e'
  [External editor]
  Type: "RESTful API for user management\n\nTech Stack:\n- Rust + Actix-web\n- PostgreSQL\n- JWT authentication"
  Save & exit
  Press Escape
  Narration: "Adding project documentation"

  Scene 7: Export Board (150-165s)

  Press 'x' (export current board)
  Type: "web-api-project.json"
  Press Enter
  [Shows: "Board exported successfully"]
  Narration: "Exporting project data to JSON"

  Scene 8: Complete More Tasks (165-185s)

  Press '2' (Tasks panel)
  Press 'j' (move down to third card)
  Press Enter
  Press '2' (Metadata)
  Press 'e'
  Type: "5" (5 story points - Red badge for critical)
  Press Enter
  Press 's'
  Type: "Blocked"
  Press Enter
  Press Escape

  Press 'j' (fourth card)
  Press 'c' (mark complete)
  Narration: "Managing task progress - marking some blocked, others complete"

  Scene 9: Import Demo (185-205s)

  Press 'i' (import)
  [File list shows: web-api-project.json, example.json]
  Press 'j'
  Press Enter
  [Shows: "1 board(s) imported successfully"]
  Narration: "Importing previously exported projects"

  Scene 10: Final Overview & Quit (205-215s)

  Press '1' (Projects)
  [Show list of boards]
  Press '2' (Tasks)
  [Show cards with different colors for story points, completion marks]

  Press 'q'
  [Auto-save message]
  [Exit to shell]
  Narration: "All changes are auto-saved on exit"

  ---
  Key Features Showcased:

  ✅ Board creation (n)✅ Card creation (n)✅ External editor integration (title & description with e)✅ Story points with color coding
  (1-5: e in Metadata)✅ Status management (s: Todo/InProgress/Blocked/Done)✅ Priority levels (p: Low/Medium/High/Critical)✅ Task
  completion (c)✅ Branch name copying (b)✅ Card ID copying (y)✅ Board settings (s)✅ Branch prefix configuration (p)✅ Board details
  editing (e from Projects)✅ Export single board (x)✅ Import boards (i)✅ Auto-save on quit✅ Panel navigation (1/2/3)✅ Vim-style
  navigation (j/k)

  Total runtime: ~3:35 minutes
  ```

cards.description:
Be able to group cards by sprints. 
Set sprint duration and automatic starting of new sprints

MVP

Board level settings defines sprint duration.

If duration is set, sprint init is possible.

Add Sprint, set start date, assign cards to it.

When end date is passed. Start up a new sprint and uncompleted cards over.

Sprint will have sprint names the same way tasks do. `prefix-<auto-increment>/sprint-name`

Prefix will be set by sprint settings.

Sprint names are derived from user supplied list or explicitly set per sprint (sprint details)

If a list of sprint names are supplied new sprint will consume each element in order

---

There should be a UI panel for sprints. On selected Board hit 's' to see sprint details

Discussion
---

Looking at this feature comprehensively, here are the potential gaps and clarifications 
  needed:

  🔴 Critical Issues

  1. Keybinding conflict: 's' is already used for board settings. Need a different key for
  sprint panel (maybe 't' for sPrinTs, or nested under settings?)
  2. Sprint rollover trigger: When end date passes, what triggers the new sprint creation?
    - On app startup check?
    - On any board action?
    - Background timer (would need tokio task)?
    - Manual user action only?
  3. Active sprint ambiguity:
    - Can only one sprint be "active" at a time?
    - Can you create future sprints in advance?
    - What's the status model? (Planning, Active, Completed, Cancelled?)

  🟡 Domain Model Gaps

  4. Sprint entity needs:
  struct Sprint {
      id: Uuid,
      board_id: Uuid,
      sprint_number: u32,
      name: String,  // format: prefix-<number>/sprint-name
      start_date: DateTime<Utc>,
      end_date: DateTime<Utc>,
      status: SprintStatus,  // Active, Completed, Planned?
      created_at: DateTime<Utc>,
      updated_at: DateTime<Utc>,
  }
  5. Board additions:
    - sprint_duration_days: Option<u32>
    - sprint_prefix: Option<String>
    - sprint_names: Vec<String>  // consumed in order
    - next_sprint_number: u32
    - current_sprint_id: Option<Uuid>  // which sprint is active?
  6. Card additions:
    - sprint_id: Option<Uuid>  // which sprint is this card in?

  🟡 Unclear Behaviors

  7. Sprint name list:
    - Once consumed, is name removed from list or just marked as used?
    - What happens when list is empty? Fall back to just sprint number?
    - Can user replenish the list?
  8. Card assignment:
    - How do users assign cards to sprints? (UI interaction)
    - Can cards exist without a sprint (backlog)?
    - What defines "uncompleted" for rollover? (status != Done?)
  9. Sprint settings UI:
    - Where do users configure duration, prefix, name list?
    - Part of board settings menu?
    - Separate sprint settings panel?
  10. Sprint completion:
    - Is there a manual "complete sprint early" action?
    - Or only automatic when end date passes?

  🟢 Architecture Questions

  11. UI Navigation:
    - Is sprint panel a new Focus mode (like Boards/Cards)?
    - Or a separate view that replaces card list?
    - How to switch between sprint view and card view?
  12. Sprint panel content:
    - List all sprints for board?
    - Show only current/active sprint?
    - Show sprint stats (cards total, completed, remaining)?
    - Burndown visualization?
  13. Card filtering:
    - Should main card list optionally filter by sprint?
    - Show sprint name/info on cards in list?
    - Visual indication of which cards are in which sprint?
  14. Time zone handling:
    - All dates in UTC internally?
    - Display in local time?
    - Sprint rollover happens at midnight in which timezone?

  📋 Implementation Order Concerns

  15. Data migration:
    - Existing boards need default values for new sprint fields
    - Existing cards get sprint_id: None (backlog)
  16. MVP boundaries:
    - MVP: Basic CRUD for sprints, card assignment, viewing
    - Future: Burndown, velocity, sprint reports, analytics
    - Which features are MVP vs future?

  ❓ Questions for You

  Before I can plan implementation:

  1. Keybinding: What key should open sprint panel? (s is taken)
  2. Rollover: Manual or automatic? If automatic, when checked?
  3. Sprint status: Can multiple sprints exist? What are the states?
  4. Card backlog: Can cards exist without sprint assignment?
  5. MVP scope: Sprint stats/burndown in MVP or future?
  6. Sprint panel: Separate focus mode or replaces card list?

  Should I proceed with assumptions and note them in the plan, or do you want to clarify these
  first?

> 1. We move board settings into the edit project ui. 
> 2. alert the user on app start up with a dialogue that start new sprint (y/n). 
> 3. multiple sprints should be allowed in parallel to allow for focused work on distinct parts of a project. yes we want to be able to plan sprints. picking tasks from the card list. The card list will be filtered to the active sprint. Planning, Active, Completed, Cancelled - yes. 
> 6. I wonder if we would need the bi directional relationship between sprint and cards? 
> 7. marked as used. for now. no list leaves the user to have to manually input a name. until a name is available the sprint name is `prefix+<auto-increment>` when a name is available it is like specified before. Yes the users supplies the list and it can be topped off whenever. 
> 8. When a sprint is initially created it is marked as in planning. then we in the sprint details interface can choose from a list of non completed tasks to include in the sprint. Yes cards can exist without a sprint as the plain list they are currently. uncompleted is only if the user makes the explicit choice not to start a new sprint after the rollover date. in such case manual creation of the subsequent sprint must occur. The user defines uncompleted. 
> 9 having a board selected. we press e to open edit project. in there we will have moved the current s, project settings. in the project settings panel we configure. duration, name list and prefix. We will replace the s with sprint details where the sprint itself can provide per sprint overrides for name list and prefix but not duration. Yes there is manual complete action. in the sprint details UI. 
> 11. The cards for the sprint can be toggled to replace the task list. for now we will use the key `t` to toggle between active sprint and the main card list. 
> 12. Tasks list will be toggled to show sprint tasks or not. Sprint details ui will handle all the rest. show list of sprints, select active sprint. stats and burndown we leave for the next iteration. 
> 12 For now, if sprint tasks are toggled just show sprint name next to the Tasks header, like Tasks - <sprint-name>. in unfiltered task list show the sprint name next to the task name, greyed out. 
> 14. All dates are in UTC internally. Display in local time. rollover in UTC. 
> 15. Yes.
> 16. MVP: Basic CRUD for sprints, card assignment, viewing and all specified. think hard and keep planning with me

---

Excellent clarifications! Let me think through the complete user flows and identify remaining
  questions:

  🤔 Critical Flows to Clarify

  Flow 1: Sprint Lifecycle Timing

  User creates sprint:
  - Status starts as Planning
  - Start date: set at creation OR when activating (Planning → Active)?
  - End date: calculated when? (start_date + duration)

  My assumption: Start date set when activating, not at creation. Makes sense for planning
  sprints in advance.

  Flow 2: Active Sprint Semantics

  You said "multiple sprints allowed in parallel" but also mentioned active_sprint_id
  (singular). I think I understand now:
  - Multiple sprints can have status Active (parallel work streams)
  - But ONE sprint is "selected active" for filtering with t key
  - active_sprint_id = currently selected sprint for filtering
  - Need action to "switch active sprint" in sprint details UI

  Confirm?

  Flow 3: Sprint Rollover Details

  On startup dialog: "Sprint X ended. Start new sprint? (y/n)"
  - If YES: Create new sprint with status Active (not Planning), auto-rollover cards where
  status != Done
  - If NO: Those cards stay in ended sprint, user must manually move later

  But: Multiple ended sprints? Show one dialog per sprint sequentially? Or one dialog listing
  all?

  Flow 4: Sprint Name Consumption

  Sprint name list = ["Cobra Kai", "Miyagi-Do", "Eagle Fang"]
  - Track usage with sprint_name_used_count: usize
  - When creating sprint: consume next name from list
  - If sprint_name_used_count >= sprint_names.len(): no name available, user must manually name
  OR fallback to prefix-<number>

  Question: Can user explicitly override auto-name even when names available?

  Flow 5: Sprint Details UI Structure

  Press s → SprintDetails mode:
  ┌─ Sprint Details ───────────────────────┐
  │ > sprint-1/Cobra Kai      [Active]     │
  │   sprint-2/Miyagi-Do      [Planning]   │
  │   sprint-3                [Completed]  │
  └────────────────────────────────────────┘

  Press Enter on selected sprint → SprintDetail mode:
  ┌─ Sprint: sprint-1/Cobra Kai ───────────┐
  │ Status: Active                         │
  │ Dates: 2025-10-12 → 2025-10-26         │
  │                                        │
  │ Cards (3):                             │
  │   ☐ Implement search                   │
  │   ☐ Add vim motions                    │
  │   ☑ Fix ordering bug                   │
  │                                        │
  │ Actions:                               │
  │ e: edit name | c: complete | x: cancel │
  │ a: add cards | r: remove cards         │
  │ s: set as active | ESC: back           │
  └────────────────────────────────────────┘

  Questions:
  - Add cards (a): show list of all unassigned cards, select with j/k/space?
  - Remove cards (r): show cards in sprint, select to remove?
  - Set as active (s): updates active_sprint_id, affects t toggle?

  Flow 6: Board Settings Panel

  Edit project (e) → navigate to panel 3 (settings):
  ┌─ Project Settings [3] ─────────────────┐
  │ Branch Prefix: task-                   │
  │                                        │
  │ Sprint Duration: 14 days               │
  │ Sprint Prefix: sprint                  │
  │                                        │
  │ Sprint Names:                          │
  │ > Cobra Kai                            │
  │   Miyagi-Do                            │
  │   Eagle Fang                           │
  │                                        │
  │ n: add name | d: delete name           │
  │ e: edit field                          │
  └────────────────────────────────────────┘

  For MVP: Keep sprint names simple:
  - Store as Vec<String>
  - Edit via external JSON? OR
  - Simple dialog: "Add sprint name:" (one at a time)
  - Delete selected name with d

  My suggestion: For MVP, manually edit JSON. Add TUI editor in next iteration.

  Flow 7: Card List Filtering

  Unfiltered (default):
  Tasks
    ☐ Fix ordering bug (sprint-1)
    ☐ Add search (sprint-2)
    ☐ Implement vim motions

  Filtered to active sprint (t pressed, active = sprint-1):
  Tasks - sprint-1/Cobra Kai
    ☐ Fix ordering bug
    ☐ Add another task

  Question: Toggle state per board or global? Probably per board.

  Flow 8: Manual Sprint Completion

  In SprintDetail mode, press c:
  ┌─ Complete Sprint: sprint-1 ────────────┐
  │ Select cards to rollover (incomplete): │
  │                                        │
  │ ☑ Fix ordering bug                     │
  │ ☑ Implement search                     │
  │ ☐ Add vim motions (Done)               │
  │                                        │
  │ Space: toggle | ENTER: complete        │
  └────────────────────────────────────────┘

  Selected cards → stay in this sprint or move to new sprint?

  My assumption:
  - Cards NOT selected = considered complete (status updated to Done automatically?)
  - Cards selected = stay in completed sprint, user manually moves later OR
  - Cards selected = auto-move to active sprint?

  Need clarification here.

  📐 Proposed Domain Model

  #[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy, PartialEq, Eq, Serialize, Deserialize)]
  pub enum SprintStatus {
      Planning,
      Active,
      Completed,
      Cancelled,
  }

  pub struct Sprint {
      pub id: Uuid,
      pub board_id: Uuid,
      pub sprint_number: u32,
      pub name: Option<String>,
      pub prefix_override: Option<String>,
      pub status: SprintStatus,
      pub start_date: Option<DateTime<Utc>>,
      pub end_date: Option<DateTime<Utc>>,
      pub created_at: DateTime<Utc>,
      pub updated_at: DateTime<Utc>,
  }

  // Board additions
  pub sprint_duration_days: Option<u32>,
  pub sprint_prefix: Option<String>,
  pub sprint_names: Vec<String>,
  pub sprint_name_used_count: usize,
  pub next_sprint_number: u32,
  pub active_sprint_id: Option<Uuid>,

  // Card addition
  pub sprint_id: Option<Uuid>,

  🏗️ Implementation Phases

  Phase 1: Board Settings Migration (smaller scope)

  1. Add Settings panel to BoardFocus (1/2/3 navigation)
  2. Move branch prefix setting to settings panel
  3. Add sprint fields to Board domain
  4. UI for editing sprint duration, prefix
  5. Sprint names: JSON-only for MVP

  Phase 2: Sprint Domain & Basic CRUD

  1. Add Sprint struct, SprintStatus enum
  2. Add sprints to App state
  3. Add sprint_id to Card
  4. Create sprint action (from SprintDetails UI)
  5. List sprints (SprintDetails mode, press s)
  6. View sprint (SprintDetail mode, Enter on sprint)
  7. Edit sprint name (dialog)
  8. Delete/cancel sprint

  Phase 3: Card Assignment

  1. Add cards to sprint (UI with card selection)
  2. Remove cards from sprint
  3. View cards in sprint detail
  4. Show sprint name next to cards in main list

  Phase 4: Sprint Activation & Toggle

  1. Activate sprint (Planning → Active, set start/end dates)
  2. Set active sprint (for filtering)
  3. Toggle card filtering with t
  4. Update card list rendering (filtered vs all)
  5. Update header (show sprint name when filtered)

  Phase 5: Sprint Lifecycle & Rollover

  1. Check ended sprints on startup
  2. Dialog per ended sprint
  3. Auto-create new sprint with rollover
  4. Manual complete sprint action
  5. Choose cards to rollover in completion UI

  ❓ Questions Before Final Plan

  1. Start date: Set at creation or activation? (I assume activation)
  2. Active sprint: One "active" per board for filtering, but multiple can have Active status?
  3. Multiple ended sprints: One dialog each, shown sequentially?
  4. Name consumption: Auto-consume next name, but allow manual override?
  5. Sprint completion: What happens to cards user selects as "incomplete"? Stay in sprint? Move
   to active sprint? User moves manually later?
  6. Sprint names list: JSON editing only for MVP, or simple add/delete UI?

  Please clarify these and I'll present the final implementation plan!

  ---
Sprint Management Implementation Plan

Overview

Add sprint functionality to kanban with MVP features: sprint CRUD, card assignment,
filtering, lifecycle management, and automatic rollover.

Phase 1: Domain Model & Board Settings

Goal: Add sprint data structures and move settings to Edit Project UI

1.1 Domain Model

- Add Sprint struct to kanban-domain/src/sprint.rs:
pub struct Sprint {
    pub id: Uuid,
    pub board_id: Uuid,
    pub sprint_number: u32,
    pub name: Option<String>,
    pub prefix_override: Option<String>,
    pub status: SprintStatus,
    pub start_date: Option<DateTime<Utc>>,
    pub end_date: Option<DateTime<Utc>>,
    pub created_at: DateTime<Utc>,
    pub updated_at: DateTime<Utc>,
}
- Add SprintStatus enum: Planning, Active, Completed, Cancelled
- Export from kanban-domain/src/lib.rs

1.2 Update Board Model

Add to Board struct:
- sprint_duration_days: Option<u32>
- sprint_prefix: Option<String>
- sprint_names: Vec<String>
- sprint_name_used_count: usize
- next_sprint_number: u32
- active_sprint_id: Option<Uuid>

Add serde defaults for deserialization.

1.3 Update Card Model

Add to Card: sprint_id: Option<Uuid>

1.4 Restructure Board Settings UI

- Change BoardFocus enum: Name, Description, Settings
- Move from BoardSettings mode → third panel in BoardDetail mode
- Press 3 to navigate to settings panel
- Move branch prefix setting to this panel
- Add sprint duration, sprint prefix fields (editable with e)
- Sprint names: JSON-only for MVP

1.5 Remove Old Board Settings

- Remove AppMode::BoardSettings
- Remove AppMode::SetBranchPrefix
- Consolidate into BoardDetail with 3 panels

Phase 2: Sprint CRUD

Goal: Create, list, view, edit, delete sprints

2.1 App State

Add to App:
- sprints: Vec<Sprint>
- sprint_selection: SelectionState
- active_sprint_index: Option<usize>
- show_sprint_cards_only: bool (toggle state per board)

2.2 App Modes

Add:
- AppMode::SprintList (press s in normal mode, board selected)
- AppMode::SprintDetail (Enter on sprint in list)
- AppMode::CreateSprint (press n in SprintList)
- AppMode::EditSprintName (press e in SprintDetail)

2.3 Sprint List UI (s key)

- Render list of sprints for active board
- Show: sprint_number/name [Status]
- j/k navigation, Enter to open detail
- n: create new sprint (Planning status)
- ESC: back to normal

2.4 Sprint Detail UI (Enter on sprint)

- Show sprint name, status, dates, card count
- Actions:
  - e: edit name (dialog)
  - a: activate (Planning → Active, set dates)
  - c: complete sprint
  - x: cancel sprint
  - d: delete sprint (only if Planning)
  - s: set as active sprint (for filtering)
  - +: add cards
  - -: remove cards
  - ESC: back to sprint list

2.5 Create Sprint

- Status: Planning
- Name: auto-consume from sprint_names[sprint_name_used_count] if available
- If no names: fallback to {prefix}-{sprint_number}
- Increment next_sprint_number and sprint_name_used_count

Phase 3: Card Assignment

Goal: Assign cards to sprints

3.1 Add Cards to Sprint (+ in SprintDetail)

- Show list of cards where sprint_id == None
- j/k navigation, Space to multi-select
- Enter: assign selected cards to current sprint
- Update card sprint_id and updated_at

3.2 Remove Cards from Sprint (- in SprintDetail)

- Show cards in current sprint
- j/k navigation, Space to multi-select
- Enter: unassign (set sprint_id = None)

3.3 Display Cards in Sprint Detail

- In SprintDetail view, show list of cards
- Format: ☐ Card title [points]

Phase 4: Card Filtering & Display

Goal: Toggle between all cards and active sprint cards

4.1 Toggle Filtering (t key in Normal mode)

- Toggle show_sprint_cards_only boolean

Phase 5: Sprint Lifecycle & Rollover                   

Goal: Activate, complete, automatic rollover           

5.1 Activate Sprint (a in SprintDetail, status = Planning)

- Change status: Planning → Active
- Set start_date = Utc::now()
- Calculate end_date = start_date + sprint_duration_days
- Only ONE sprint can be Active at a time (check and prevent if another active exists)

5.2 Startup Check for Ended Sprints

- If any found, show dialog:

5.3 Automatic Rollover (if "yes" to dialog)

  - Create new sprint (status = Active, auto-name)
  - Move incomplete cards to new sprint
  - Set new sprint dates

5.4 Manual Complete Sprint (c in SprintDetail)

- Show list of cards in sprint with status != Done
- Checkboxes for each card (default: all selected)
- Space: toggle, Enter: complete
- Selected cards: move to next Active sprint (or create new if none)
- Unselected cards: stay in sprint, user moves manually later
- Mark sprint as Completed

Phase 6: Polish & Integration

Goal: Help text, validation, error handling

6.1 Help Text Updates

- Update keybindings in footer

6.2 Validation

- Prevent activating sprint if duration not set
- Prevent multiple Active sprints
- Validate dates

6.3 Auto-save

- Sprints auto-save to JSON along with boards/cards

Implementation Order

1. Phase 1 (domain + settings UI migration)
2. Phase 2 (sprint CRUD, basic UI)
3. Phase 3 (card assignment)
4. Phase 4 (filtering, display)
5. Phase 5 (lifecycle, rollover)
6. Phase 6 (polish)

- ✅ Rollover dialog shows all ended sprints with checkboxes
- ✅ Manual completion: selected cards move to next sprint
- ✅ Sprint names list: JSON editing for MVP
- ✅ Settings moved to Edit Project UI panel 3

cards.description:
Identify patterns of repetition in the code

Phase 1: Refactoring Plan: Extract Reusable Components
---

Critical Issues Identified

1. app.rs (1,818 lines) - BLOATED

- Giant handle_key_event method (876 lines!)
- 20x repetitions of board access pattern
- 16x duplicate dialog handling
- Export logic duplicated 3 times
- Card filtering duplicated throughout

2. ui.rs (1,227 lines) - MASSIVE DUPLICATION

- 14 similar popup render functions
- 97x Style::default() calls (no theming)
- 18x Block::default() (no builder pattern)
- Repetitive list/selection rendering

---
Refactoring Strategy (8 Phases)

Phase 1: Extract Event Handlers (~600 lines → 8 files)

Create crates/kanban-tui/src/handlers/:
- mod.rs - Re-exports
- board_handlers.rs - Board-related keys (create/rename/edit/export)
- card_handlers.rs - Card keys (create/toggle/assign/priority)
- sprint_handlers.rs - Sprint keys (create/activate/complete)
- navigation_handlers.rs - Movement (j/k/1/2/Enter/Esc)
- dialog_handlers.rs - All dialog input modes
- popup_handlers.rs - Import/order/assign selection

Phase 2: Extract Business Logic Helpers (~150 lines)

Create crates/kanban-tui/src/helpers/:
- board_helpers.rs - get_active_board(), get_board_cards(), etc.
- card_helpers.rs - get_sorted_cards(), filter_cards(), etc.
- sprint_helpers.rs - get_board_sprints(), etc.

Phase 3: Extract Export/Import Logic (~300 lines)

Create crates/kanban-tui/src/export/:
- serialization.rs - BoardExport, AllBoardsExport structs
- export.rs - Export functions
- import.rs - Import functions

Phase 4: Extract Styling System (~200 lines)

Create crates/kanban-tui/src/theme/:
- colors.rs - Color constants (focused, selected, status colors)
- styles.rs - Pre-built styles (focused_border, selected_item, etc.)
- builders.rs - BlockBuilder, ListItemBuilder

Phase 5: Extract UI Components (~400 lines)

Create crates/kanban-tui/src/components/:
- popup.rs - Generic popup rendering (DRY up 14 functions)
- list.rs - Generic list rendering with selection
- detail_view.rs - Detail view patterns
- input_field.rs - Input field widget

Phase 6: Extract String Utilities (~100 lines)

Create crates/kanban-core/src/utils/:
- string.rs - to_kebab_case, truncate, validation

Phase 7: Extract Command Pattern (~200 lines)

Create crates/kanban-tui/src/commands/:
- mod.rs - Command trait
- board_commands.rs - CreateBoard, RenameBoard, etc.
- card_commands.rs - CreateCard, ToggleCard, etc.

Phase 8: Refactor Main Files

- app.rs: 1818 → ~600 lines
- ui.rs: 1227 → ~400 lines
- card.rs: 309 → ~200 lines

---
Expected Results

- ~2,000 lines extracted into 25+ focused modules
- Each module < 150 lines
- Eliminate 80% of code duplication
- Cleaner separation of concerns
- Easier testing and maintenance

Phase 2: Extract Business Logic & Apply SOLID Principles
---

Current Problems

app.rs (866 lines) has mixed concerns:
- UI state management (TUI-specific)
- Business logic (filtering, sorting, queries)
- Export/import serialization (duplicated 3x)
- No separation = can't reuse in CLI/API

SOLID Analysis

Violations Found:

1. SRP: app.rs does UI state + business logic + persistence
2. OCP: Hard to extend filtering/sorting without modifying code
3. DIP: App depends on concrete implementations, not abstractions
4. ISP: No focused interfaces for different operations

Architecture Plan

New Module Structure

crates/kanban-tui/src/
├── services/
│   ├── mod.rs
│   ├── query.rs          - Read-only queries (boards, cards, sprints)
│   ├── filter.rs         - Card filtering logic (sprint, assignment)
│   ├── sort.rs           - Card sorting logic (priority, points, date)
│   └── validation.rs     - Business rule validation
├── export/
│   ├── mod.rs
│   ├── models.rs         - Serialization DTOs (BoardExport, etc.)
│   ├── exporter.rs       - Export to JSON
│   └── importer.rs       - Import from JSON
├── app.rs                - UI state ONLY (selection, focus, mode)
└── handlers/             - Event handlers (✅ done in Phase 1)                                                                                                                                      │

Potential New Crate (Future):

crates/kanban-service/    - Shared business logic for all interfaces
├── query_service.rs      - Cross-entity queries
├── command_service.rs    - CRUD operations
└── validation.rs         - Domain validation rules

SOLID Principles Applied

1. Single Responsibility Principle (SRP)

Before:
impl App {
    // UI state
    pub board_selection: SelectionState

    // Business logic
    pub fn get_sorted_board_cards() { ... }

    // Export logic
    pub fn export_board_with_filename() { ... }
}

After:
// UI state only
impl App {
    pub board_selection: SelectionState
}

// Business logic service
pub struct CardQuery<'a> {
    cards: &'a [Card],
    columns: &'a [Column],
}

// Export service
pub struct BoardExporter { ... }

2. Open/Closed Principle (OCP)

Extensible filtering without modifying existing code:

pub trait CardFilter {
    fn matches(&self, card: &Card) -> bool;
}

pub struct SprintFilter { sprint_id: Uuid }
pub struct AssignmentFilter { hide_assigned: bool }
pub struct CompositeFilter { filters: Vec<Box<dyn CardFilter>> }

3. Liskov Substitution Principle (LSP)

Consistent query interfaces:

pub trait Query<T> {
    fn find_by_id(&self, id: Uuid) -> Option<&T>;
    fn find_all(&self) -> Vec<&T>;
}

impl Query<Board> for BoardQuery<'_> { ... }
impl Query<Card> for CardQuery<'_> { ... }

4. Interface Segregation Principle (ISP)

Small, focused traits:

pub trait CardReader {
    fn get_board_cards(&self, board_id: Uuid) -> Vec<&Card>;
}

pub trait CardSorter {
    fn sort_cards(&self, cards: &mut [&Card]);
}

// Not one giant "CardService" with 20 methods

5. Dependency Inversion Principle (DIP)

Depend on abstractions:

// High-level App depends on trait
impl App {
    fn render_cards(&self, query: &impl CardReader) {
        let cards = query.get_board_cards(board_id);
    }
}

// Low-level implementation
pub struct CardQuery<'a> { ... }
impl CardReader for CardQuery<'_> { ... }

Implementation Steps

Step 1: Extract Query Service (~200 lines)

- services/query.rs
- CardQuery, BoardQuery, SprintQuery
- Pure read operations, no mutations
- Reusable across TUI/CLI/API

Step 2: Extract Filter Service (~150 lines)

- services/filter.rs
- CardFilter trait
- SprintFilter, AssignmentFilter, CompositeFilter
- Composable, testable filters

Step 3: Extract Sort Service (~100 lines)

- services/sort.rs
- CardSorter trait
- Implementations for each SortField
- Strategy pattern for sorting

Step 4: Extract Export/Import (~300 lines)

- export/models.rs - DTOs
- export/exporter.rs - Serialization
- export/importer.rs - Deserialization
- Eliminate 3x duplication

Step 5: Refactor app.rs (~200 line reduction)

- Keep only UI state
- Delegate to services
- app.rs: 866 → ~650 lines

Benefits

Reusability

✅ CLI can use same services without TUI dependency                                                                                                                                                  │
✅ Future API can use same business logic                                                                                                                                                            │
✅ Services testable in isolation                                                                                                                                                                    │

Maintainability

✅ Clear boundaries between layers                                                                                                                                                                   │
✅ Easy to find and modify business rules                                                                                                                                                            │
✅ No duplication (DRY)                                                                                                                                                                              │

Extensibility

✅ Add new filters without touching existing code                                                                                                                                                    │
✅ Add new sort strategies easily                                                                                                                                                                    │
✅ Plug in different export formats                                                                                                                                                                  │

Test Strategy

Each service gets unit tests:
#[test]
fn test_sprint_filter() {
    let filter = SprintFilter::new(sprint_id);
    assert!(filter.matches(&card_in_sprint));
    assert!(!filter.matches(&card_not_in_sprint));
}

Migration Path

1. Extract services (new code, no breaking changes)
2. Update app.rs to use services
3. Remove old inline implementations
4. Run tests at each step
5. Commit atomically (9-12 focused commits)

---
Total Reduction: ~400 lines extracted + 200 lines eliminated
Result: app.rs 866 → ~650 lines, business logic reusable

Phase 2 completed
---

We are looking good in the progress of this refactoring.

I think it only doesnt happen in kanban view!

kanban/crates/kanban-tui/src/handlers/card_handlers.rs, the handle_move_card_left() and handle_move_card_right()

handlers have a critical bug:

In kanban view (ColumnView), the code only updates column selection but never calls refresh_view():

if self.is_kanban_view() {
    if let Some(current_col_idx) = self.column_selection.get() {
        if current_col_idx > 0 {
            self.column_selection.set(Some(current_col_idx - 1));
        }
    }
} else {
    self.refresh_view();  // <-- This is only in the else branch!
    self.select_card_by_id(card_id);
}

This means:
- The card's column_id and position ARE updated in memory
- But the UI is NOT re-rendered to show the change
- The kanban view doesn't redraw with the card in its new location

In flat/grouped views, it works because refresh_view() IS called.

There may also be a secondary issue: the handlers depend on get_selected_card_in_context() returning a card, which relies on the view
strategy having a selected card. If card selection isn't being maintained properly, the handlers wouldn't execute at all.

Plan to Fix

Here's what needs to be done:

1. Add refresh_view() call to the kanban view branch in handle_move_card_left() (line ~349)
2. Add refresh_view() call to the kanban view branch in handle_move_card_right() (line ~405)
3. Add select_card_by_id() call after refresh in both handlers to maintain card selection
4. Verify that card selection is being properly initialized when switching views
5. Test the fix to ensure cards move and stay selected in all view modes

> TLDR; it does happen it just doesnt update

2025-11-01 22:23:04
---

I think I made a slight mistake during the design of this addition

these are all for use with branch names to specific cards. that we got right.

Here are the overrides with example prefixes

```sh
default prefix (DEFAULT)

|
v

_application settings prefix (APP)_ [future]

|
v

board settings sprint prefix (BRANCH)

|
v

sprint settings prefix (SPRINT)
```

Creating sprints with just the default prefix yields sprints of

```sh
sprint-1/first 
sprint-2/second 
sprint-3/third 
```

Then adding branch prefix transforms these into 

```sh
BRANCH-1/first 
BRANCH-2/second 
BRANCH-3/third 
```

Then assigning the first sprint a sprint prefix

```sh
SPRINT-1/first 
BRANCH-2/second 
BRANCH-3/third 
```

Then creating four cards and assigning them to each sprint

```sh
task1 (SPRINT-1/first)
task2 (BRANCH-2/second)
task3 (BRANCH-3/third)
task4 (SPRINT-1/first)
```

They get the following branch names

```sh
git checkout -b SPRINT-1/task1
git checkout -b BRANCH-2/task2
git checkout -b BRANCH-3/task3
git checkout -b SPRINT-4/task4
```

The branch naming sequence isnt unique for each prefix!

It is a global sequence where as the sequence for the cards should be unique to each

So. To clarify. There is a couple of sequences going on here.

We have one sequence for each new sprint of the same prefix.

We have a seperate sequence for each new card that also uses the sprint prefix.

There is an unfortunate collision in that the sprint names use the same prefix as the cards.

This was not supposed to be the case. The sprint prefix we had from before this feature was supposed to give us a way to customize the sprint name for each sprint sequence. we moved this into the sprint level definition. This was good for the tasks. but bad for the sprint sequence. I think we have identified all the issues here above. Can we come up with a good plan for resolution?
cards.title: we probably should move sprint prefix into sprint level settings

cards.description:
## Context
The current conflict resolution uses `LastWriteWinsResolver` in `kanban-persistence/src/conflict/resolver.rs`. When external file changes are detected via `FileWatcher` (`watch/file_watcher.rs`), the system compares `saved_at` timestamps from `PersistenceMetadata`.

## Current Behavior
1. `JsonFileStore::save()` checks `last_known_metadata` (Mutex-wrapped) before writing
2. If file changed externally, `KanbanError::ConflictDetected` is raised
3. TUI shows dialog: "Keep Local" or "Reload from Disk"
4. Last-write-wins means the newer `saved_at` timestamp wins

## Documentation Required
Create `docs/CONFLICT_RESOLUTION.md` covering:
- How conflict detection works (mtime + size + content hash triple-check)
- Scenarios where data loss occurs:
  - Two instances edit different cards simultaneously → one set of changes lost
  - Rapid saves within same second → timestamp collision possible
  - Network filesystems with clock skew
- Why proper solutions (OT/CRDT) are complex for this use case
- Recommendation: "Single-instance recommended for data integrity"

## Files to Reference
- `crates/kanban-persistence/src/conflict/detector.rs` - FileMetadata struct
- `crates/kanban-persistence/src/conflict/resolver.rs` - LastWriteWinsResolver
- `crates/kanban-persistence/src/watch/file_watcher.rs` - ChangeDetector trait
- `crates/kanban-tui/src/app.rs` - conflict dialog handling

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] New docs/CONFLICT_RESOLUTION.md with clear warnings
- [ ] README.md updated with link and brief warning
- [ ] Code comments in resolver.rs explaining limitations
cards.title: Document conflict resolution limitations

cards.description:
## Context
The save queue is implemented in `kanban-tui/src/state/mod.rs`:
- `SAVE_QUEUE_CAPACITY = 100` bounded MPSC channel
- Uses `try_send()` which returns `TrySendError::Full` when capacity reached
- Currently logs warning and DROPS the save silently

## Current Problem
When queue is full, saves are dropped with just a warning log. This causes silent data loss.

## Implementation Options
1. **Block writes** - Change to `send().await` (requires async refactor)
2. **Drop oldest** - Replace channel with `VecDeque`, evict oldest on overflow
3. **Expand queue** - Use unbounded channel (memory risk)
4. **Backpressure** - Disable UI input when queue > 80% full

## Recommended Approach
Implement backpressure with clear user feedback:
1. Add `queue_pressure()` method returning 0.0-1.0 ratio
2. Show warning in status bar when > 80%
3. Block new commands when queue full (not silent drop)
4. Document the behavior in README

## SOLID Considerations
- Single Responsibility: Keep save queue logic in dedicated `SaveQueue` struct
- Open/Closed: Make overflow strategy configurable via trait
- Extract `SaveQueueStrategy` trait for different behaviors

## Files to Modify
- `crates/kanban-tui/src/state/mod.rs` - StateManager save queue
- `crates/kanban-tui/src/ui/status_bar.rs` - queue pressure indicator
- `crates/kanban-core/src/traits.rs` - SaveQueueStrategy trait (new)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] No silent data loss on queue overflow
- [ ] User-visible feedback when queue is filling
- [ ] Configurable overflow strategy
- [ ] Unit tests for overflow scenarios
