cards.description:
## Context
Current tests are example-based only. No property-based testing despite complex domain logic.

## Areas Requiring Property-Based Tests

### 1. Migration Paths (V1→V2)
Location: `kanban-persistence/src/migration/migrator.rs`
- Roundtrip: migrate then demigrate equals original
- Migration preserves all board/card/column counts
- Migration never loses data (bijective mapping)

### 2. Card Ordering Logic
Location: `kanban-domain/src/card.rs`, `column.rs`
- Positions are contiguous after any operation
- No duplicate positions in same column
- Reorder operations maintain invariants

### 3. Sprint Calculations
Location: `kanban-domain/src/sprint.rs`
- activate(sprint, days).end_date == start_date + days
- Sprint status transitions follow state machine
- Sprint numbers are monotonically increasing per board

### 4. Board State Consistency
Location: `kanban-domain/src/board.rs`
- prefix_counters always >= max card_number for that prefix
- Cards always reference valid column_id within same board
- Archived cards maintain referential integrity

## Implementation Plan
1. Add `proptest` to dev-dependencies in relevant crates
2. Create `tests/property_tests.rs` in each crate
3. Use `proptest::arbitrary::Arbitrary` derive for domain types
4. Generate random valid states, apply operations, verify invariants

## SOLID Considerations
- Create `Invariant` trait for testable properties
- Each domain type implements `Arbitrary` for generation
- Reuse arbitraries across test modules

## Files to Create/Modify
- `crates/kanban-domain/Cargo.toml` - add proptest dev-dep
- `crates/kanban-domain/tests/property_tests.rs` - new
- `crates/kanban-persistence/tests/migration_properties.rs` - new
- `crates/kanban-domain/src/arbitrary.rs` - Arbitrary impls (new)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] proptest configured in workspace
- [ ] >=10 property tests for migration
- [ ] >=10 property tests for card ordering
- [ ] >=5 property tests for sprint logic
- [ ] >=5 property tests for board consistency
- [ ] CI runs property tests with sufficient iterations
cards.title: Add property-based tests for domain logic

cards.description:
## Context
Current `JsonFileStore` loads entire state into memory and serializes full JSON on every save. This is O(n) for both read and write, blocking scalability past ~1000 cards.

## Architecture: Implement Behind PersistenceStore Trait
The `PersistenceStore` trait in `kanban-persistence/src/traits.rs` is the seam for adding new storage backends.

## Implementation Plan

### Phase 1: Schema Design
Create `schema.sql` with tables for: metadata, boards, columns, cards, sprints, archived_cards. Add indexes for common queries (cards by column, cards by sprint).

### Phase 2: SqliteStore Implementation
New file: `kanban-persistence/src/store/sqlite_store.rs`
- Use `sqlx` with SQLite driver (async-compatible)
- Implement `PersistenceStore` trait
- Transaction wrapping for atomic operations
- Connection pooling for concurrent access

### Phase 3: Incremental Saves (Key Optimization)
Instead of full-state snapshots:
- Track dirty entities in `DirtyTracker` struct
- Only INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE changed rows
- Use `updated_at` timestamps for conflict detection

### Phase 4: Migration from JSON
- Detect `.json` vs `.db` file extension
- Auto-migrate: load JSON -> create SQLite -> write all entities
- Keep JSON as backup until verified

## SOLID Considerations
- **Single Responsibility**: SqliteStore only handles persistence, not domain logic
- **Open/Closed**: Add new store without modifying existing code
- **Liskov**: SqliteStore substitutable for JsonFileStore via trait
- **Dependency Inversion**: TUI/CLI depend on PersistenceStore trait, not concrete impl

## Abstraction for JSON vs SQL
Create shared `StoreOperations` trait for common patterns that both JsonFileStore and SqliteStore implement.

## Files to Create/Modify
- `crates/kanban-persistence/Cargo.toml` - add sqlx, feature flag
- `crates/kanban-persistence/src/store/sqlite_store.rs` - new
- `crates/kanban-persistence/src/store/mod.rs` - export SqliteStore
- `crates/kanban-persistence/src/schema.sql` - DDL
- `crates/kanban-persistence/src/migration/json_to_sqlite.rs` - new
- `crates/kanban-cli/src/main.rs` - store selection logic

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] SqliteStore implements PersistenceStore trait
- [ ] Feature flag: `--features sqlite` to enable
- [ ] JSON->SQLite migration preserves all data
- [ ] Incremental saves (not full snapshots)
- [ ] Concurrent read safety via connection pool
- [ ] Benchmarks showing improvement over JSON
cards.title: Implement SQLite storage backend

cards.description:
## Context
Error handling uses `KanbanError` enum in `kanban-core/src/error.rs` with `thiserror`. Recovery procedures are undocumented.

## Error Types to Document
- Connection(String) - Future: DB/network errors
- NotFound(String) - Entity lookup failures
- Validation(String) - Invalid input
- Io(std::io::Error) - File operations
- Serialization(String) - JSON parse/write failures
- Internal(String) - Unexpected states
- ConflictDetected { path, source } - External file modification

## Failure Scenarios to Document

### 1. Corrupted JSON File
- Cause: Disk corruption, incomplete write, manual edit error
- Current behavior: Serialization error, app won't start
- Recovery: Check for .v1.backup, use kanban export, manual JSON repair

### 2. Disk Full During Atomic Write
- Cause: Filesystem at capacity during temp file write
- Current behavior: Io error in atomic_writer.rs
- Recovery: Original file preserved, free disk space and retry

### 3. External Editor Crash
- Cause: $EDITOR crashes during card description edit
- Current behavior: Edit cancelled, original preserved
- Recovery: Automatic - no data loss

### 4. File Permission Errors
- Cause: Read-only file, directory permissions
- Current behavior: Io error with OS message
- Recovery: chmod fix, check directory ownership

### 5. File Watcher Failure
- Cause: Too many watches (ulimit), unsupported filesystem
- Current behavior: Warning logged, continues without watching
- Recovery: Increase ulimit, use polling mode

## Documentation to Create
- `docs/ERROR_HANDLING.md` with all scenarios
- Troubleshooting section in README
- Error codes table with recovery steps

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All KanbanError variants documented
- [ ] Recovery procedure for each failure mode
- [ ] Troubleshooting guide with common issues
- [ ] Error messages improved with actionable hints
cards.title: Document error handling behavior

## Context
Claude is listed as a contributor. Transparency about AI-assisted development builds trust.

## Content to Add to CONTRIBUTING.md

### Section: "AI-Assisted Development"

This project uses AI assistance (Claude by Anthropic) for:
- Code generation and refactoring
- Documentation writing
- Test case generation
- Code review suggestions

### Review Process for AI-Generated Code
All AI-generated code undergoes the same review as human contributions:
1. Automated CI checks (clippy, tests, formatting)
2. Human review for correctness and style
3. Integration testing before merge

### Patterns to Watch For
AI-generated code may exhibit:
- Over-abstraction (unnecessary traits/generics)
- Verbose error handling
- Missing edge cases in generated tests
- Documentation that restates code instead of explaining intent

### Attribution
AI-assisted commits are attributed to the human who reviewed and approved them.
The AI tool is listed in commit trailers when significant generation occurred.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Review process documented
- [ ] Common AI patterns listed for reviewers

cards.description:
## Context
Current architecture (JSON + last-write-wins) fundamentally supports single-user only.
Roadmap mentions HTTP API, collaboration, sync - these require different foundations.

## Decision Framework

### Option A: Personal Tool (Recommended)
Keep current architecture, optimize for single-user experience:
- SQLite for performance (not collaboration)
- No server component
- File sync via external tools (Dropbox, git)
- Document limitations clearly

Implications: Remove collaboration from roadmap, focus on offline-first, simpler maintenance

### Option B: Team Tool
Rewrite for collaboration:
- PostgreSQL or similar server DB
- HTTP API with authentication
- Real-time sync (WebSockets)
- CRDT or OT for conflict resolution

Implications: 6-12 month rewrite, different deployment model, hosting concerns

### Option C: Hybrid
Personal-first with optional sync:
- SQLite locally
- Optional sync to remote server
- Conflict resolution for sync only

Implications: Complexity of both approaches, edge cases in sync logic

## Decision Process
1. Write ADR (Architecture Decision Record) in `docs/adr/`
2. Update README with chosen scope
3. Update roadmap to match
4. Close/adjust related issues

## Files to Create/Modify
- `docs/adr/001-project-scope.md` - new ADR
- `README.md` - update project description
- `ROADMAP.md` - align features with scope

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] ADR documenting decision and rationale
- [ ] README clearly states scope
- [ ] Roadmap updated to match
- [ ] Collaboration features removed or deferred
cards.title: Decide project scope: personal vs team tool

cards.description:
## Context
Domain layer uses command pattern (`kanban-domain/src/commands/`), but commands are not persisted. Need to evaluate if this adds value or just complexity.

## Current Implementation Analysis

### What Exists
- `Command` trait with `execute()` and `description()`
- Commands for all CRUD operations
- `CommandContext` with mutable refs to all state
- Command descriptions logged to `VecDeque<String>` (audit only)

### What's Missing for Event Sourcing
- Commands not persisted to storage
- No replay mechanism
- No event versioning
- No projection rebuilding
- No undo/redo

### Questions to Answer
1. Are commands persisted? -> No, only snapshots
2. Is this event-sourcing? -> No, just structural pattern
3. Can we implement undo/redo? -> Not without persisting commands
4. Does the abstraction help? -> Provides uniform API, but adds indirection

## Evaluation Criteria
- Keep if: Command pattern enables future undo/redo, improves testability
- Simplify if: Just adding boilerplate without benefit

## Recommendation
Keep command pattern BUT document its purpose:
- Enables uniform operation interface for TUI/CLI
- Provides audit log via descriptions
- Future-proofs for undo/redo if commands are persisted
- Add `Undoable` trait for commands that support reversal

## Files to Analyze
- `crates/kanban-domain/src/commands/mod.rs`
- `crates/kanban-domain/src/commands/*.rs` - all command impls
- `crates/kanban-tui/src/state/mod.rs` - command execution

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Document command pattern purpose in code comments
- [ ] Add `Undoable` trait (empty for now, marks intent)
- [ ] Create `docs/ARCHITECTURE.md` explaining design decisions
- [ ] Decision: keep, simplify, or extend for undo/redo
cards.title: Evaluate command pattern implementation

## Context
Sprint model exists but is basic. No velocity tracking, burndown data, or retrospective artifacts.

## Current Sprint State
```rust
pub struct Sprint {
    id, board_id, sprint_number, name_index,
    prefix, card_prefix, status,
    start_date, end_date,
    created_at, updated_at
}
```

## Missing Features

### 1. Velocity Tracking
Add fields:
- committed_points: Option<u32> - Points at sprint start
- completed_points: Option<u32> - Points marked done
- velocity_history: Vec<u32> - Rolling average data

### 2. Burndown Data
Add structure:
- BurndownEntry { date, remaining_points, completed_points }
- burndown: Vec<BurndownEntry>

### 3. Sprint Goals
Add fields:
- goal: Option<String> - Sprint objective
- retrospective: Option<String> - Post-sprint notes

## Implementation Approach

### Option A: Full Agile (8 points)
Implement all above + TUI charts for burndown

### Option B: Minimal (3 points)
Just card grouping + basic completion tracking

### Recommended: Option A with phased rollout
1. Add data model fields (this ticket)
2. Capture burndown data on card status changes
3. Add velocity calculation on sprint complete
4. TUI visualization (separate ticket)

## SOLID Considerations
- `SprintMetrics` struct for calculations (SRP)
- `MetricsCalculator` trait for different methodologies
- Keep Sprint struct focused on state, metrics in separate module

## Files to Modify
- `crates/kanban-domain/src/sprint.rs` - add fields
- `crates/kanban-domain/src/sprint_metrics.rs` - new
- `crates/kanban-persistence/src/migration/` - V2->V3 migration
- `crates/kanban-tui/src/ui/sprint_view.rs` - display metrics

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Sprint tracks committed vs completed points
- [ ] Burndown data captured daily (or on change)
- [ ] Velocity calculated on sprint completion
- [ ] Migration handles existing sprints gracefully

## Context
Unit tests exist but integration tests are limited. Need tests that verify full system behavior.

## Test Scenarios Required

### 1. Full Board Lifecycle
create board -> add columns -> create cards -> move cards ->
archive cards -> export JSON -> delete board -> reimport -> verify equality

### 2. Multi-File Scenarios
- Switch between different kanban files
- Ensure no state leakage between files
- Verify file watcher correctly tracks active file

### 3. External Editor Integration
- Set $EDITOR to test script
- Verify edit flow works
- Test editor crash recovery

### 4. File Watcher Behavior
- Modify file externally during session
- Verify conflict detection triggers
- Test "reload" vs "keep local" paths

### 5. Migration Scenarios
- Create V1 format file
- Load with current version
- Verify auto-migration
- Check backup creation

### 6. Sprint Lifecycle
- Create sprint -> assign cards -> activate -> complete
- Verify card sprint_logs updated
- Test sprint cancellation

## Implementation Plan

### Test Infrastructure
- Use `tempfile` for isolated test directories
- Create `TestHarness` struct for common setup
- Use `assert_cmd` for CLI black-box tests
- Mock external editor with script

### Test Organization
```
tests/
  integration/
    board_lifecycle.rs
    multi_file.rs
    external_editor.rs
    file_watcher.rs
    migration.rs
    sprint_lifecycle.rs
  helpers/
    mod.rs
    harness.rs
    fixtures.rs
```

## SOLID Considerations
- `TestHarness` trait for reusable setup (DIP)
- Fixture builders for test data (Builder pattern)
- Each test file focused on one scenario (SRP)

## Files to Create
- `crates/kanban-cli/tests/integration/` - test directory
- `crates/kanban-cli/tests/helpers/harness.rs` - TestHarness
- Individual test files per scenario

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] >=1 test per scenario above
- [ ] Tests run in CI
- [ ] Tests isolated (no shared state)
- [ ] Test helpers reusable across scenarios
- [ ] Coverage report includes integration tests
